content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-198-15-A |Item_parent=Microcrystalline arthropathies |Item_parent_short=Microcrystalline arthropathies |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the two essential biological tests for the diagnosis of gout |Description=uricemia, estimation of glomerular filtration rate (MDRD or CKD-EPI) |Section=Additional tests |Contributors= |Order=15}} - Uricemia, which may be normal during a gouty attack - Serum creatinine with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR, using MDRD or CKD-EPI formulae) - A blood count will also be taken.

properties.question: Which of the following biological tests is essential for the diagnosis of gout?
properties.option_b: Serum creatinine with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR, using MDRD or CKD-EPI formulae)
